text: Life with Murder is a Canadian documentary film, directed by John Kastner and released in 2010."How parents cope when one sibling kills another". Toronto Star, April 28, 2010. The film profiles Brian and Leslie Jenkins, a couple in Chatham, Ontario who are struggling to cope and heal after their son Mason was convicted of murdering their daughter Jennifer."When your daughter's killer is your son: Documentary paints portrait of parents' 'unconditional love'". Toronto Star, August 31, 2010. The film premiered at the Hot Docs Canadian International Documentary Festival on May 1, 2010,"Jenkins family 'thrilled' by reception to murder documentary: director". Canadian Press, May 7, 2010. and was distributed primarily as a television film which aired on CTV Television Network on August 31, 2010. The film won the Donald Brittain Award for Best Social/Political Documentary Program at the 26th Gemini Awards,"Robertson gets Gemini for journalism contribution". Waterloo Region Record, August 31, 2011. and the International Emmy Award for Best Documentary at the 39th International Emmy Awards. == References == == External links == * Category:2010 films Category:Canadian films Category:Donald Brittain Award winning shows Category:Films directed by John Kastner Category:National Film Board of Canada documentaries
